featured.text: For thousands of years, the Chinese have valued highly the soybean, considering it one of the five important grains (along with rice, millet, barley, and wheat).
Modern flip-flops derive from Japanese zōris, which were often worn with socks dividing the big toe from the rest, and were typically made of rice straw.
Mike fainted under the hot sun in his rice field.
Rubber thus replaced rice straw as the major material for the flip-flop.

definition.zh_def: 稻米，主要的穀物之一，通常用作食物。
definition.en_def: A cereal grain that is a staple food for a large part of the world's population.
definition.example: She cooked a pot of rice to serve with the curry.
